column4: hey guys, I installed Ubuntu 6.10 but GRUB doesn't load on startup
I'm guessing it's because I used a floppy to disable grub earlier
My computer turns on, by it boots directly into XP
hold down the escape key when you boot, and see if the menu shows up. If it does, that means it's fixable.
I mean XP and Ubuntu... sorry
in that case, it's not what thekidrio thinks it is.
i think he was right... you don't need to hold Esc.
when it boots, choose the other HD from the boot list.
what were your other werid problems? I'm curious
use "sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf" to get into a text editor.
It keeps showing up as a blank document when I type {{{sudo nano /ect/X11/xorg.conf}}}
Is there a command to immediately shutdown?
yeah, instead of waiting 1 minute when I type {{{sudo shutdown 1}}}
